# Task

Write a pig latin transformer called `pig_latinify` that operates on a vector of strings. It iterates over each string and changes it to pig latin. Each iteration should run on a separate thread.



# Data

pig_latinify(["hello", "apple", "strong", "world"])

```julia
using Threads, TextAnalysis

function pig_latinify(strings)
    transformed = Vector{String}()

    for string in strings
        transformed_string = transform_to_pig_latin(string)
        push!(transformed, transformed_string)
    end

    transformed
end

# Example data
strings = ["hello", "apple", "strong", "world"]

# Transform the data using multiple threads
@threads results = pig_latinify(strings)

# Print the transformed strings
results
```
This code defines a `pig_latinify` function that iterates over input strings, transforming each one into pig latin. It uses the `Threads.@threads` macro to parallelize the processing of individual strings.

The provided example data is transformed using multiple threads and then printed out.
